title: tikv fatal error after upgrading when running ch and cc workload
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
Now version:

Release Version:   6.5.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   d58343d03890c3970178bffc0e9fafdd3a0d7df0
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v6.5.0-alpha
UTC Build Time:    2022-11-15 11:11:04
Rust Version:      rustc 1.67.0-nightly (96ddd32c4 2022-11-14)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release

previous version:

Release Version:   6.4.0
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   220a263c665b42a43cec3e38f2d9b46ffe074ca9
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v6.4.0
UTC Build Time:    2022-11-04 07:20:37
Rust Version:      rustc 1.64.0-nightly (0f4bcadb4 2022-07-30)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
1. run ch workload
2. run cc workload
3. upgrade 6.4.0 to master
### What did you expect?
no error
### What did happened?
1. there are 18 tikv in cluster
2. before upgrade, tikv running stably
4. but now many of tikv occurred fatal errors
5. they have 2 kinds of stack as below

stack 1: 
`[2022/11/16 15:23:47.073 +08:00] [FATAL] [lib.rs:495] ["called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value"] [backtrace="   0: tikv_util::set_panic_hook::{{closure}}

comments_data.body:
stack 1 may be duplicated with #13764
stack 2 may be new issue
